actions.text: Amendment (A015) offered by Ms. Sanchez, Loretta.
On agreeing to the Sanchez, Loretta amendment (A015) Failed by recorded vote: 195 - 230 (Roll no. 125).

description: Amendment sought to stop the practice of granting risk score reductions for nonvalidated Customs-Trade Partnership Against Terrorism or C-TPAT companies.
purpose: An amendment numbered 15 printed in House Report 109-450 to prohibit the current Customs and Border Protection (CBP) practice of granting automated targeting risk score reductions to Customs Trade Partnership Against Terrorism (C-TPAT) members that have not received CBP validation of the implementation and effectiveness of their security measures.
